title: Introducing: BILLIONAIRE
body:
So **BILLIONAIRE** is one of those artists where on first listen I wanted nothing more than to turn it off, but for some weird reason, couldn’t quite bring myself to do so.

On second listen, I found it somewhat more bearable, and on third listen, I was head over heels in love. BILLIONAIRE is London’s (Whitechapel) John J Sterry, lead singer of Gaoler’s Daughter, who’ve played with Babyshambles and Graham Coxon as well as receiving support from Zane Lowe. Sterry’s two solo tracks, _Tammy Paints Pictures / Trustees_ and _Poverty Line_ are jerky, odd-pop gems, never quite settling on a specific genre or trend, cavorting wildly through psych-rock and almost Talking Heads-esque chorus sections. Check out both tracks below.

_I steal my neighbour’s roses / drive a car that’s older than Moses_
